transcript.text: shabbat shalom it's getting toward the
end of day two of the feast of
unleavened bread and I just want to do a
brief brief YouTube on the unleavened
bread you can see that the way that the
the matzah is made the unleavened bread
it is pierced see those holes it's
pierced and it's also striped see the
stripes it's in the holes are in stripes
so it's interesting that it's made by
being pierced and striped because
Yahshua of course was also pierced and
striped when he was beaten and crucified
to the cross so the Jews make the matzah
this way they've made it this way for
thousands of years not even realizing
that the very matzo that they're making
the way that they make it has symbolism
of Yahshua and his death on the cross so
I just wanted to point that out
and in case you didn't know that lots of
symbolism and the feast of Passover a
botch alone
